gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components
Interface IMutableVirtualArray2D

All Superinterfaces:
IVirtualArray, IVirtualArray2D
All Known Implementing Classes:
VirtualArray2D
public interface IMutableVirtualArray2D
extends IVirtualArray2D

This interface defines methods to set values and error values for elements of an IVirtualArray2D.

Method Detail

setRowValues

void setRowValues(float[] values,
                  int row,
                  int start)
Set values for a portion or all of a row. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, set values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Parameters:
values - array of elements to be put into the row
row - row number of desired row
start - what column number to start at

setColumnValues

void setColumnValues(float[] values,
                     int column,
                     int start)
Set values for a portion or all of a column. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, set values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Parameters:
values - array of elements to be put into the column
column - column number of desired column
start - what row number to start at

setDataValue

void setDataValue(int row,
                  int column,
                  float value)
Set value for a single array element.

Parameters:
row - row number of element
column - column number of element
value - value that element will be set to

setRegionValues

void setRegionValues(float[][] values,
                     int row_start,
                     int col_start)
Sets values for a specified rectangular region. This method takes in a 2D array that is already organized into rows and columns corresponding to a portion of the virtual array that will be altered.

Parameters:
values - 2-D array of float values
row_start - first row of the region being altered
col_start - first column of the region being altered

setErrors

boolean setErrors(float[][] error_values)
Set the error values that correspond to the data. The dimensions of the error values array should match the dimensions of the data array. Zeroes will be used to fill undersized error arrays. Values that are in an array that exceeds the data array will be ignored.

Parameters:
error_values - The array of error values corresponding to the data.
Returns:
true if data array dimensions match the error array dimensions.

setSquareRootErrors

void setSquareRootErrors(boolean use_sqrt)
Use this method to specify whether to use error values that were passed into the setErrors() method or to use the square-root of the data value.

Parameters:
use_sqrt - If true, use square-root. If false, use set error values if they exist.
